revised_title: French Scientists' Visit to London During World War II
tldr: In January 1940, a delegation of French scientists visited London during World War II to establish closer collaboration between British and French organizations responsible for applying science to the war efforts of the Allies. The Royal Society played an active role in supporting this visit, which aimed to strengthen the relationship between the two countries and promote cooperation in scientific research.
